Package model.project.repository

Interface ProjectRepository

All Known Implementing Classes:
SqliteProjectRepository
public interface ProjectRepository
ProjectRepository specifies the methods required from any class implementing database access for project-related updates, insertions, deletions and queries.
Author:
Bori Fazakas

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void deleteProject​(int projectId)
    Deletes the project with the specified id from the database.
    java.util.Optional<Project> getProject​(int projectId)
    Finds the project with the given id and returns it, if it exists.
    java.util.Optional<Project> getProject​(int teamId, java.lang.String name)
    Finds the project with the given teamId and title/name and returns it if it exists.
    java.util.List<Project> getProjects​(java.util.EnumSet<Project.Status> allowedStatuses, java.lang.Integer assigneeId, java.lang.Integer supervisorId, java.util.EnumSet<Project.DeadlineStatus> allowedDeadlineStatuses, Project.SorterType sorterType, boolean descending)
    Returns a list of all the projects assigned to a user with assigneeId, if assigeeId is not null, otherwise assigned to any user, supervised by a user with id supervisorId, if supervisorId is not null, otherwise supervised by any user, having any status specified by queryStatus (possibly ALL), and a status with respect to the deadline specified by queryDeadlineStatus.
    java.util.List<Project> getProjectsOfTeam​(int teamId, java.util.EnumSet<Project.Status> allowedStatuses, java.lang.Integer assigneeId, java.lang.Integer supervisorId, java.util.EnumSet<Project.DeadlineStatus> allowedDeadlineStatuses, Project.SorterType sorterType, boolean descending)
    Returns a list of all the projects in the team with teamId, assigned to a user with assigneeId, if assigeeId is not null, otherwise assigned to any user, supervised by a user with id supervisorId, if supervisorId is not null, otherwise supervised by any user, having any status specified by queryStatus (possibly ALL), and a status with respect to the deadline specified by queryDeadlineStatus.
    int saveProject​(Project.SavableProject project)
    Saves the project in the database and assigns it an id, which is returned.
    void updateProject​(Project project)
    Updates the data of the project, which must already exist in the database with the same id, with the data specified by the project object.

  • Method Details

    • saveProject

      int saveProject​(Project.SavableProject project) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException
      Saves the project in the database and assigns it an id, which is returned.
      Parameters:
      project - is the project to save.
      Returns:
      the id of the newly saved project in the database.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operations could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException

    • getProject

      java.util.Optional<Project> getProject​(int projectId) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Finds the project with the given id and returns it, if it exists.
      Parameters:
      projectId - is the id of the project to search for.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the found project, if it exists in the database. Otherwise, an enmpty Optional.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operations could not be performed in the database.

    • getProject

      java.util.Optional<Project> getProject​(int teamId, java.lang.String name) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Finds the project with the given teamId and title/name and returns it if it exists.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team in which the project is supposed to be,
      name - is the name/title of the team that is searched.
      Returns:
      an Optional containing the found project, if it exists in the database. Otherwise, an enmpty Optional.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operations could not be performed in the database.

    • updateProject

      void updateProject​(Project project) throws java.sql.SQLException, InexistentDatabaseEntityException
      Updates the data of the project, which must already exist in the database with the same id, with the data specified by the project object.
      Parameters:
      project - holds the id of the existing project and the possibly new data to be saved.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operations could not be performed in the database.
      InexistentDatabaseEntityException

    • deleteProject

      void deleteProject​(int projectId) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Deletes the project with the specified id from the database. Requirement: any entities having foreign keys to these projects must already be deleted.
      Parameters:
      projectId - is the id of the project to delete.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operation could not be performed in the database.

    • getProjectsOfTeam

      java.util.List<Project> getProjectsOfTeam​(int teamId, java.util.EnumSet<Project.Status> allowedStatuses, java.lang.Integer assigneeId, java.lang.Integer supervisorId, java.util.EnumSet<Project.DeadlineStatus> allowedDeadlineStatuses, Project.SorterType sorterType, boolean descending) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Returns a list of all the projects in the team with teamId, assigned to a user with assigneeId, if assigeeId is not null, otherwise assigned to any user, supervised by a user with id supervisorId, if supervisorId is not null, otherwise supervised by any user, having any status specified by queryStatus (possibly ALL), and a status with respect to the deadline specified by queryDeadlineStatus.
      Parameters:
      teamId - is the id of the team whose projects are returned.
      allowedStatuses - is the set of the statuses allwoed for the returned projects. Projects with any other status will be discarded.
      assigneeId - is an optional parameter. If it is null, it doesn't count. Othwerise, only those projects are returned, which are assigned to the user with id assigneeId.
      supervisorId - is an optional parameter. If it is null, it doesn't count. Othwerise, only those projects are returned, which are supervised by the user with id supervisorId.
      allowedDeadlineStatuses - is the set of deadline statuses which are allowed in the query result.
      sorterType - specifies by which attribute the projects must be sorted.
      descending - specifies the order of sorting. If true, the projects are sorted in descending order, otherwise ascending. If the sorterType is NONE, this parameter does not count.
      Returns:
      the list of projects fulfilling all the above requirements.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operations could not be performed in the database.

    • getProjects

      java.util.List<Project> getProjects​(java.util.EnumSet<Project.Status> allowedStatuses, java.lang.Integer assigneeId, java.lang.Integer supervisorId, java.util.EnumSet<Project.DeadlineStatus> allowedDeadlineStatuses, Project.SorterType sorterType, boolean descending) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Returns a list of all the projects assigned to a user with assigneeId, if assigeeId is not null, otherwise assigned to any user, supervised by a user with id supervisorId, if supervisorId is not null, otherwise supervised by any user, having any status specified by queryStatus (possibly ALL), and a status with respect to the deadline specified by queryDeadlineStatus.
      Parameters:
      allowedStatuses - is the set of the statuses allwoed for the returned projects. Projects with any other status will be discarded.
      assigneeId - is an optional parameter. If it is null, it doesn't count. Othwerise, only those projects are returned, which are assigned to the user with id assigneeId.
      supervisorId - is an optional parameter. If it is null, it doesn't count. Othwerise, only those projects are returned, which are supervised by the user with id supervisorId.
      allowedDeadlineStatuses - is the set of deadline statuses which are allowed in the query result.
      sorterType - specifies by which attribute the projects must be sorted.
      descending - specifies the order of sorting. If true, the projects are sorted in descending order, otherwise ascending. If the sorterType is NONE, this parameter does not count.
      Returns:
      the list of projects fulfilling all the above requirements.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - if the operations could not be performed in the database.
